thread.title: IUN to host 35th annual forum on child abuse, neglect
thread.title_full: IUN to host 35th annual forum on child abuse, neglect

author: Michael Howie michael.howie@nwi.com, 219-319-7682
title: IUN to host 35th annual forum on child abuse, neglect
text:
GARY — Indiana University Northwest's Center for Urban and Regional Excellence will on Friday host the 35th annual Forum on Child Abuse and Neglect to provide continuing education and a platform for social workers, foster parents, Department of Child Services (DCS) employees and interested community members to converse in public policy discussions surrounding mistreated juveniles.
April is Child Abuse Prevention Month.
IUN has hosted the forum every year since 1991, though it has grown over the years. Today, its organizers tout it as "one of the premier child abuse prevention events in Northwest Indiana."
The forum will be held at the Bergland Auditorium inside IUN's Savannah Center. It begins at 9 a.m. and is scheduled to wrap up around 4 p.m.
The event is free to the public and includes a complimentary lunch. Registration is available online on IUN's website.
Keynote speaker
Takkeem Morgan, the Senior Communications Director for Prevent Child Abuse America, will deliver this year's keynote address. His presentation, scheduled to begin at 9:15 a.m., will highlight the opportunities that exist for innovation related to child safety and family well-being.
Workshops
There are six scheduled workshops in the morning, from 10:45 a.m. to noon
- Lake County Child Welfare: Trends and Issues, led by Lake County regional DCS manager Twan Stokes and Lake County Superior Court Juvenile Division Thomas Stefaniak
- Indiana Co-Care: Foster Care Reimagined, led by Julie Villarreal and Nicollette Love
- The Power of Connection and Belonging, led by Lani Kieft
- Sexual Abuse Prevention: Introduction to Stewards of Children, led by Sara Hoyt
- Immigration 2025: Law and Administrative Practices, led by Sophia Ashad
- The Juvenile Detention Alternatives Initiative (JDAI), led by Kevin Elkins
Six more workshops will follow a free lunch and networking session. Afternoon classes are from 1 p.m. to 2:45 p.m.
- Building Emotional Resilience, led by Rebekah Enzler
- Protective Factors as Child Maltreatment Prevention, led by Amy Strakor Wisor and Sarah Johnson
- Immigrants’ Rights and the Impact on Families, led by Anthony Burrell
- LGBTQIA+ Issues for Children and Families, led by Natalie Lukich
- The Lake County Family Recovery Center, led by Beth Rechlicz
- The National Communications Strategy of Prevent Child Abuse America, led by Takkeem Morgan
The Director of the Indiana DCS, Adam Krupp, will give a guest presentation to wrap up the day.
For more information, visit IUN's Center for Urban and Regional Excellence website.
